speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, it's been such fun talking about psycho-pharmacological solutions to maladaptive personality traits that I can't believe the three hours is almost gone.  Up next is the news followed by...  [_Roz raps on the window and holds up a note that reads 'BIKE-A-THON"._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, but Roz is reminding me that next Saturday is the first annual KACL AIDS Bike-A-Thon.  It's bound to be an afternoon of family, fun, and lots of surprises, so dust off your velocipedes and I'll see you there.  [_He disconnects and stands up as Kenny comes in._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Great pitch, Doc.  So, uh, what are the surprises?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, first and foremost:  I am not going.

speaker: Roz
text: But you just told them you'd see them there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Roz, I'm merely getting the rubes into the tent.  I will gladly give my money, but spending the afternoon riding bicycles with a bunch of hooligans is not my idea of fun.

speaker: Kenny
text: It's just kids and families.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well so was the KACL family picnic at the zoo, until those urchins jostled me into the orangutan grove.  Let me tell you: orangutans are not the playful gentlemen of the trees the nature shows claim.  [_Julia walks in._]

speaker: Julia
text: Hello.

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Julia.

speaker: Frasier
text: Julia.

speaker: Kenny
text: You're goin' to the Bike-A-Thon, right?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, don't embarrass her, Kenny.  I mean, it's gotta be tough, finding a comfortable bike seat when you're such a tight-ass.

speaker: Julia
text: This from a woman who "peddles" her ass all over town.  [_Roz starts for her._]

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, lady...  [_Frasier grabs Roz and pulls her back._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, stalemate.  Well done, well done.  Keep moving, come on.  [_He ushers her back to her booth._]

speaker: Kenny
text: So, Bike-A-Thon, you're in, right?

speaker: Julia
text: Nah, I can't be bothered, I'll just send a check.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, cheese and rice, what's wrong with you people?

speaker: Julia
text: Relax, Kenny, I'm just pulling your leg.  How can I not go? This is funding AIDS research, for God's sake.  I know you think I'm heartless and self centered, but at least give me credit for being human.

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, Frasier's not goin'.  [_Frasier lets out a forced, fake laugh._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  Kenny, come on!  I was pulling your leg too!  I tell you what, we should have a fund raiser for your sense of humor.  All right, I'll see you there.  [_He claps Kenny on the back, then crosses through Roz's side of the booth._]

speaker: Roz
text: You're pathetic.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know.  [_He exits.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Martin is hurrying to catch the elevator._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hold it!  [_He hurries and presses the button so the doors open again.  He steps inside, then notices the other person.  It is Cora Winston, the mother of Frasier's upstairs neighbor, last seen in[[9.24] "The Love You Fake"](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_24/moons_over_seattle.html) _

speaker: Martin
text: Cora.  Hi.

speaker: Cora
text: Marty.  [_The doors close and the elevator starts up.  Martin looks nervous, Cora looks firmly ahead._]

speaker: Martin
text: Visiting your son?

speaker: Cora
text: Yes.

speaker: Martin
text: Cora, I'm sorry, but I gotta ask you.  What happened?  I thought we had a pretty nice thing, but then you stopped returning my calls.

speaker: Cora
text: Why don't you ask your other girlfriend?

speaker: Martin
text: What other girlfriend?

speaker: Cora
text: That bizarre English lady who told me to leave you alone. Because she was in the British Secret Service and had a license to kill.  [_The doors open._]

speaker: Cora
text: Here's your stop.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez, that was Daphne's mother.  She had a thing for me, but it was never mutual.  [_The doors close and the elevator continues._]

speaker: Martin
text: Did she show you a badge?  Always ask to see a badge.

speaker: Cora
text: I knew she wasn't a secret agent.  But she was pretty convincing about the two of you.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Cora, I'm so sorry.  It's not true.  [_The doors open again and they step out into the foyer on Cam's floor._]

speaker: Cora
text: I'm sorry too.  I should have asked about her.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, hey, it's cleared up now.  Maybe we could pick up where we left off.  Or skip ahead, your choice.

speaker: Cora
text: That would've been nice, but I've been seeing someone lately.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure, of course you have.  Stupid of me.

speaker: Cora
text: But I'm very glad to see you again.  Please give Eddie my love.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah.  He'll be sorry he missed you.  He liked your ankles.  [_She goes into Cam's apartment.  When the door closes, Martin smacks his cane against the floor in frustration, then turns and mashes the button for the elevator, furious.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Gertrude and Daphne are on the couch.  Niles is leaning against the table behind it.  Frasier hurries in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, sorry for the hold up, guys.  Ah, listen, I think it's best if we take separate cars to the flower show.  See, later I have to go buy a bicycle.  [_Daphne gets up and heads to the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: For whom?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, for me.  I've been dragooned into riding for the KACL AIDS Bike-A-Thon.

speaker: Niles
text: Poor devil, spending the day on a bike.  I don't envy you.  [_He starts seriously, but a malicious grin breaks through.  Daphne sticks her head out of the kitchen._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, why don't we enter the Bike-A-Thon?  [_She ducks back into the kitchen, leaving Niles stunned and nervous. He looks to Frasier, who is grinning._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You had to see that coming.  [_Daphne comes out of the kitchen._]

speaker: Daphne
text: We can all go to the shop together, after the flower show.

speaker: Niles
text: Sure, why not.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, you two would look so cute on matching bicycles.

speaker: Niles
text: I guess it would be a kick, eh Frasier?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Not you two, ya nit!  You and Daphne.  [_Martin comes in, slams the door and points at Gertrude._]

speaker: Martin
text: You!

speaker: Gertrude
text: Hello.

speaker: Martin
text: I just had a very interesting discussion with Cora Winston. Seems someone claiming to be my girlfriend scared her off.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh dear.  Is she the woman from the bookstore?

speaker: Martin
text: No.  The bookstore?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum, is this true?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Well, I'm sure I don't know what Marty's talking about, but it was probably back when we were an item.

speaker: Martin
text: We were NEVER an item!  Now I would like for you to leave.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now Dad, calm down.  I'm sure you can talk this over with Cora and have a good laugh afterwards.

speaker: Martin
text: Ha ha!  Very funny.  Now that she's practically married to this guy.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_rising_]  Oh, Martin, I'm sorry.  I guess didn't realize...

speaker: Martin
text: Apology not accepted.  You went too far, we are no longer speaking.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Marty...

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, Mrs. Moon.  Mrs. Moon...shut up.  [_He ushers her out the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Dad, we're leaving now.  We're going over to the flower show and after that we're going to a sporting goods store to buy a couple of bikes.

speaker: Martin
text: Nice try, Fras, but I'm too mad to laugh.  [_Frasier, nonplussed, just closes the door behind him.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.   Frasier and Niles are with a salesman, looking over a selection of bikes._]

speaker: Niles
text: This one has good lines.  You have any without this bar here?

speaker: Salesman
text: You mean girl's bikes.  Sure.

speaker: Niles
text: Good.  'Cause my wife's a girl and she'll need one of those.

speaker: Salesman
text: Nice.  Maybe I'll go see how she's doing.  [_He walks off.  Niles covers his face._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, we can't stall much longer.  I mean, one seems as good as the next, is there anything else we need?

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm, let me see.  Oh, yes, I know.  We need to know HOW TO RIDE THEM!

speaker: Frasier
text: Shh!  We will learn.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, as easy as that?  Look at these machines, Frasier.  These are BICYCLES!  There is nothing between you and the ground but the ground itself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  And if a child of FOUR can ride one, then so can we.

speaker: Niles
text: That's what we said when we were six!  If Daphne finds out, she'll probably...  [_He breaks off as a man in biking gear comes over to look at the bikes they're standing at._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Metal spokes.  I like that.

speaker: Niles
text: I should buy the horn separately.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh-huh.  [_The man walks away._]

speaker: Niles
text: That was close.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I am not going to look like an idiot at that Bike-A-Thon. Tonight, I am going to a parking lot and come hell or high water, I am going to master cycling.  You're welcome to join me.

speaker: Niles
text: I guess I could sneak out.  Perhaps it's time to slay the dragon.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the stuff, brother.  [_The customer comes over by them again._]

speaker: Niles
text: Call me crazy, but I like a bouncy tire.

speaker: Frasier
text: Two bouncy tires and a...taut chain.  That's good ridin'.  [_They smile bravely until the customer heads off again._]

speaker: Niles
text: Where did you learn all that?  That was really good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just a matter of confidence, Niles.  [_SMASH CUT TO - Frasier's apartment, later that night.  Frasier comes in the front, struggling with his new bike and muttering.  Niles is behind him._]

speaker: Niles
text: All a matter of confidence, he says.  [_Frasier turns the lights on to reveal that they are covered with scratches and bruises._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well perhaps two people who don't know how to ride bikes shouldn't try to teach each other.

speaker: Niles
text: A good teacher doesn't yell at his student.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nor does a good teacher throw a stick at his student!  [_Niles clutches his knee._]

speaker: Niles
text: I thought it would make you try harder.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you're going to make a hell of a dad!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, what are we going to do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's not panic.  We still have two days before the Bike-A-Thon.  Surely the library has shelves devoted to this topic.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't have time for that!  Daphne wants to go biking tomorrow afternoon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then you're just going to have to tell her that you don't know how to ride.

speaker: Niles
text: I can't!  It's too late!  If I was going to do that, I should have done it at the bike store.  But NOOO!  You, YOU said we could teach ourselves!  You said no one would be the wiser!  [_As he continues to shout, Frasier makes calming gestures._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: "Two bouncy tires and a taut chain" you said!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: And now look!  My spokes are bent, my pants are stuck, and there's blood on the headlight, and blood everywhere...  [_He breaks down as Frasier tries to comfort him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, that wasn't your fault.  That jogger should have been wearing a reflective vest.  Come on.  Come and sit down.  I'm going to get you a nice sherry.  [_He heads for the sherry.  Niles tries to move, but his pants are still stuck in the chain so he carries the bike with him.  Fade out._]  _Act 2  Scene 1 - Cafe Nervosa_  [_Fade in.  Niles is sitting at a table, Frasier is getting coffee at the counter.  Roz comes up behind him._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi Roz.  You're welcome to join me and Niles.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I can't.  I'm on my way to meet Alice and her sitter. Alice wants to practice riding her bicycle for Saturday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Roz
text: Mm-hm, she loves it.  I mean, she had that bike one day before she made me take her training wheels off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Tell me, does she ever find that she feels as though her feet are frozen to the pedals?  Stuck in a confused, arrhythmic battle between forward and reverse, until finally, with no locomotive momentum whatsoever, she keels over like a felled tree?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well good, good.  Because... that's a real thing that happens to some kids.  [_He sits down with Niles as Roz steps to the counter.  Daphne and Gertrude come in._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello Daphne, Mrs. Moon.  [_They all say hello to each other as the ladies sit._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm afraid I have some bad news.

speaker: Niles
text: What is it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Someone stole our new bikes.

speaker: Niles
text: My God, are you sure?  [_to waiter_]  Can I get a refill? That's terrible.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, that's curious.  Niles, didn't that salesman say nothing could break those titanium locks?

speaker: Niles
text: You're right.  I must not have locked them properly. Foolish Niles.

speaker: Gertrude
text: You know, I spotted a couple of bikes in the storage room, behind the furnace.  Perhaps you could borrow those.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I don't think so.  The theft has soured me on the whole bike experience and what were you doing behind the furnace anyway?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Drinking.  [_Martin walks up to the table._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hello Daphne, Niles, Frasier.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Hello, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: How are the three of you doin'?  Mind if I join you?

speaker: Niles
text: Sure.  [_Martin pulls another chair up to the table._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, you're not still angry at me, are you?

speaker: Martin
text: Coffee please.  [_Roz stops on her way out._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Wow, everybody's here today.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, grab a seat, I'd love to have a lady sit next to me.  [_Gertrude looks very put out._]

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks, I can't.  I'm on my way to the park.  I just got a call from the babysitter.  Alice did a wheelie!  [_The others all sound happy at this._]

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I'll see you guys later.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's great, Roz.  Bye-bye.  [_She leaves._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, someone's raising a real little showoff.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, now, not everyone was meant to ride a bike.

speaker: Daphne
text: What does that mean?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm just saying my boys are good at other things. Indoor things.  [_Daphne casts a suspicious look at Frasier._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no.  You don't mean...

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, Daphne.  Frasier doesn't know how to ride a bike.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, neither do you!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, she was bound to find out!  [_to Daphne_]  We never learned.

speaker: Martin
text: I tried teachin' 'em, but I had to take them to the hospital so many times, social services started sniffin' around.

speaker: Niles
text: All these years, it's been our secret shame.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and it hasn't been easy concealing it, either.  People are always saying in conversation "It's just like riding a bike."  I can smile, and nod.  But I only understand it in theory.

speaker: Niles
text: We tried to teach ourselves last night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, can you imagine a sadder tableaux:  two grown men trying to gain mastery over a child's toy and failing miserably.

speaker: Niles
text: Even more pathetic:  a grown man faking the theft of his and his wife's bicycles.  I disgust myself.  I'm so sorry, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, you've no need to apologize. Lots of people don't know how to ride.

speaker: Niles
text: Really?

speaker: Gertrude
text: No.

speaker: Daphne
text: It doesn't matter.  I can take you to the park and teach you.  I'll teach you both.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really, Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, I adore you.  [_He kisses her._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: No, seriously.  Who?

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, I'm afraid my bike may be too damaged to ride.

speaker: Daphne
text: So we'll borrow one from someone in the building.  I promise you, you two are going to learn how to ride bikes.

speaker: Martin
text: You're a good wife, Daphne.  And I'll bet you were a good daughter when your mother was alive.  [_Gertrude crosses her arms and glares at him while everyone else tries to not be involved.  Fade out._]   **CYCOLOGY**  [_Fade in.  Frasier is there with his bike, Niles is on a grade-school bike with high handlebars and a banana seat.  Daphne is standing just off the path._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Helmet.

speaker: Niles
text: Check.

speaker: Frasier
text: Pads.

speaker: Niles
text: Check.

speaker: Frasier
text: Cup.  [_Frasier adjusts his athletic supporter, but Niles touches the sport bottle on the handlebars._]

speaker: Niles
text: Check.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right.  Now remember:  keep your eyes open and pedal quickly.  I just want to get an idea of your individual skill levels.  All right, everyone ready?  And...go!  [_The boys lift their feet up to the pedals, but don't push off or pedal.  They twitch for an instant, then fall against each other, propped up.  Being on the shorter bike, Niles is about elbow high with Frasier._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Okay, good start.  Now, let's try again, but this time further apart.  [_Frasier pulls his bike away from Niles'._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  I think this is going to be all right.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, this isn't so bad.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right.  And...go!  [_The boys bring their feet up, then put them right back down for balance.  After a couple of false starts, they start moving forward, terrified looks on their faces.  Daphne watches them, smiling._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, very good.  [_Her expression quickly becomes worried as there are sounds of crashing and pain.  She starts forward, darting from side to side, unsure which of them needs help more.  Music from "The Barber of Seville" begins playing as we see a montage of Niles and Frasier trying desperately._]  [_N.B. This theme was also used in the 1979 Oscar-winning film "Breaking Away" about an American small-town teenager who becomes so obsessed with a team of Italian bike race champions that he creates an Italian persona for himself, including listening to Rossini's operas._]  [_Frasier seems to be getting along, until he sees a tree.  Focusing on it with a horrified look, he crashes into it and falls down.  Daphne is running alongside Niles on his small bike.  They pass behind a hedge and only Daphne and the bike emerge.  Daphne stops and looks around for her husband.  Frasier again crashes into the tree and falls over.  Niles is exhausted and reaches for the sports bottle.  However, he is unable to get it loose.  Later, he unwraps a power bar to eat.  But he pulls the wrapper all the way down and his snack falls to the ground while Frasier watches.  He opens the spout on the sports bottle and picks the bike upright so he can drink from it.  Niles and Daphne are at the "killer tree", urging Frasier to the side. He makes the turn and avoids the tree, looking happy.  Niles and Daphne cheer him on, then watch him circle around until they have to quickly move aside before Frasier once more strikes the tree head on and ends up on the ground.  Daphne again runs alongside Niles.  They disappear behind the hedge, the music reaches its finale... and this time Niles emerges alone on the bike, smiling triumphantly.  Daphne jumps up and down and claps her hands, proud and happy.  The music ends.  Now that Niles has learned, they focus on Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: It's that damned sycamore!  It's got a magnetic hold on me.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's because you keep focusing on it.  Whatever you do, put it out of your mind.  The more you think about it, the worse it gets.

speaker: Niles
text: You're a cloud, scudding across a clear blue sky.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm a cloud.  [_He takes off again._]

speaker: Niles
text: You're a cloud.  A cloud...  [_Frasier looks worried for a moment, but manages to swerve away from the tree._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I AM a cloud!  I'm flying!  Look, I'm riding a bike.  [_He's ecstatic, but is soon passed by a young girl on a bike with training wheels, then a pregnant woman jogging, then a gray-haired man on a razor scooter.  Nonetheless, he seems happy at his accomplishment. The finale of the music repeats.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  The doorbell rings and Martin hurries to answer as it rings again._]

speaker: Martin
text: I heard ya.  I'm comin'.  [_He opens the door to reveal Gertrude, holding some flowers and a sandwich._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Hello.  [_Martin slams the door in her face and starts walking away.  She pounds on the door and he goes back again._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez!  [_He opens the door and speaks before she can._]

speaker: Martin
text: Look.  I'm sorry.  I'm still ticked.  I'm not proud of it, but I have to do the right thing and that means hold this grudge.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Ah!  You're talking to me.  I knew you would.  [_He slams the door in her face again.  Cut to - the entryway as she turns around.  Cora is just coming off the elevator._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, you're here to see Marty?

speaker: Cora
text: Actually, I think not.  [_She turns away._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Look, no.  This isn't what it looks like.  I'm here to apologize.  But since he's not talking to me, I guess I can say me piece to you.  Now, first of all, don't be scared. I'm not a secret agent and I don't have a license to kill. Back when I said all that to you, I wasn't really in me right mind, anyway.  I mean, I'd just separated from me husband and...well, maybe I hoped Marty would be some kind of...knight in shining armor.  But we were never a couple, though.

speaker: Cora
text: It was a pretty rotten thing you did.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Yes, I know, dear, just awful.  In me defense, I've done much worse.  And besides, between you and the girl at the bookstore, I liked you better.  [_Cora looks a little confused at this.  Cut to - inside the apartment. Martin is relaxing in his chair when the doorbell rings.  Rolling his eyes, he gets up._]

speaker: Martin
text: Sonovabitch!  [_He goes to the door and opens it to reveal Cora holding the flowers and sandwich, a big smile on her face._]

speaker: Martin
text: Cora!  Hi, come on in.  [_She enters and hands him the things and he sets them on the table behind the couch._]

speaker: Cora
text: Hi.  I ran into a friend of yours.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, she's no friend of mine.

speaker: Cora
text: Well, she had some nice things to say about you.  Maybe we could talk about it at dinner tomorrow.

speaker: Martin
text: I thought you were seeing someone.

speaker: Cora
text: I don't see him here.

speaker: Martin
text: I guess not.  Pick you up at seven?

speaker: Cora
text: Seven it is.  So...who's this girl from the bookstore?

speaker: Martin
text: See you tomorrow.  [_He ushers her out the door and shakes his fist in a victory gesture. Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Lots of people are lined up under a banner marked Start and Finish.  Frasier and Niles are at the front, Niles still with his borrowed bicycle._]

speaker: Martin
text: Never thought I'd see the day.  This is really somethin'.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's right.  You faced your fears and you bested them.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, thanks to you.  [_He gives her a kiss._]

speaker: Niles
text: And who knows?  Maybe this is just be the beginning.  There are still mountains to conquer.  The diving board, for instance.

speaker: Frasier
text: Or cartwheels.

speaker: Martin
text: Be careful out there, Son.

speaker: Frasier
text: I will, Dad.  Thanks.  I guess I better go take my place, huh?

speaker: Martin
text: Okay.  [_Frasier wheels his bike over to where Kenny and Julia are waiting._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, Julia.

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Doc.

speaker: Julia
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, have a good ride.

speaker: Kenny
text: Not gonna happen.  These shorts are already bunchin' me somethin' fierce.  Excuse me.  [_He gets off his bike to get more comfortable._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Pretty exciting.

speaker: Julia
text: Thrilling.  You don't mind if we don't ride together, do you? I like to go at my own pace.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not at all.  You don't have to feel like you have to keep up.  [_She laughs at this._]

speaker: Julia
text: Right.  Well, what do you say we make it interesting?

speaker: Frasier
text: What did you have in mind?

speaker: Julia
text: Last one across the finish line doubles the other's pledges.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're on.  And I look forward to watching you write that big fat check.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!  Remember:  keep your eye on the road and don't fixate on anything you can crash into.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right!

speaker: Niles
text: Good luck!  [_Frasier gives Niles a thumbs up as the starter pistol goes off.  The crowd cheers as the cyclists start off._]

speaker: Julia
text: Boy, I hope I can steer around that big mailbox right there.  _Ciao!_  [_She speeds off.  Frasier starts out, but, cursed by her suggestion, focuses on the mailbox and rides straight into it.  As he falls to the sidewalk, Roz and Alice come riding up._]

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier?

speaker: Alice
text: Are you okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll be all right.  Why don't you guys go ahead.  I'll catch up to you.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  [_She and Alice ride off.  Frasier gets back on his bike and gets going._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord.  Pardon me.  Beep beep!  Oh, gosh, no.  Oh, dear God!  [_Frasier doesn't get very far, circling back and crashing into the mailbox once more.  This time he manages to keep to his feet as the bike falls to the ground.  Fade out._]
